com.camerontec.catalys.util.thread

Class ManagedThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.thread.ManagedThread
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ManagedThreadHelper

    public class ManagedThread
extends Object
    This class manages the creation and destruction of threads. The start method creates the thread the thread then calls IManagedThreadWorkPlace.process on the IManagedThreadWorkPlace which was passed in on the constructor. The benefits of doing this over traditional thread creation is the ability to stop the threads cleanly. Plus you can created and destroy multiple threads easily.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagedThread

        protected ManagedThread(String name)
        This is a special constructor for the ManagedThreadHelper since it can't reference this until super constructor has been called. A real chicken and egg problem.
        Parameters:
        name - name

      • ManagedThread

        public ManagedThread(String name,
                     IManagedThreadCallbacks callback)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the threads
        callback - object implementing logic executed by the threads

    • Method Detail

      • setDaemon

        public void setDaemon(boolean daemon)
        Set this as a daemon or non-daemon thread. This will take effect after the next start().
        Parameters:
        daemon - whether or not this should be a daemon thread.

      • isDaemon

        public boolean isDaemon()
        Find out if this is a daemon thread.
        Returns:
        true if this is a daemon thread, false otherwise.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns:
        name

      • processLoop

        public final void processLoop(int threadId)
        Calls process on. Implementing thread should implement the process() method.
        Parameters:
        threadId - thread id

      • start

        public void start()
        This can be called more that once to create additional worker threads. Each new thread has a different id which is passed into the IManagedThreadWorkPlace.process(id) method so that threads can be identified.

      • shutdownAllWorkerThreads

        public void shutdownAllWorkerThreads()
        Causes all worker threads to exit cleanly using the default timeout for the join operation (1 sec).

      • shutdownAllWorkerThreads

        public void shutdownAllWorkerThreads(long timeoutForJoin)
        Causes all threads to exit cleanly. If the given timeout is smaller than zero, no join operation will be performed.
        Parameters:
        timeoutForJoin - join timeout

      • join

        public void join(long timeout)
        Return as soon as all the threads have joined or when the timeout expires.
        Parameters:
        timeout - timeout

      • stillAlive

        public boolean stillAlive()
        Returns:
        the alive boolean flag

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This will stop the thread on the next call to processLoop shutdown() causes the thread to stop immediately.

      • getDefaultPriority

        public int getDefaultPriority()
        Returns:
        the current default thread priority

      • setDefaultPriority

        public void setDefaultPriority(int value)
        Parameters:
        value - the thread priority of newly created threads.
